title: Has anyone broken down into insanity in front of you? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a matter of fact, yes. When I was a small child, a neighbor came to the apartment I shared with my mother and proceeded to lie down on the rug and roll around. She refused my mother’s offer to call a doctor. My mother, under 30 at the time, must have been terrified. I guess my mom called an ambulance anyway. A while later, the woman was taken from our apartment and we could hear her screaming near the elevators, “Take your dirty hands off me!” She, too, must have felt terrified. My mother, not wanting to waste a teachable moment, turned to me and asked, “Do you see why I tell you not to scream?”

Depends what you mean by insanity. It’s not a word I would use. Has a client ever broken down in tears? Yes, many times. Has a client ever said “I think I’m going crazy here”? Yes, often. I think we are all a little bit broken, tbh. I hope this helps? I’m wondering if you’re considering therapy and fear “breaking down” in front of your therapist? If so, I hope you find a lovely one who will support you

Years ago I encountered this girl in Goa. She spend her days galloping along the beaches. When I inquired about her someone told me that she believes herself to be a horse ever since she took a bad mix of E and something else. Her well-to-do parents have tried everything to free her from it. Like sending her to the best clinics in Switzerland. She was utterly unhappy there. So they employed a caretaker to look after her in Goa, make sure she eats and sleeps well. And gave her the freedom to live her life as a horse. I haven't seen her in the years after. But I hope she’s galloping still on some beautiful beach being happy as a horse.
